dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 68-page bipartisan report just completely cleared Donald Trump of all financial wrongdoing.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the 68-page filing, James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misled investors by inflating the value of its assets. James has not concluded the investigation, and has not reached a determination regarding whether the facts identified to date establish violations of law, according to the complaint.

dialogue_turns.text: And it was led by, um, Rudolph Giuliani, the former Attorney General. He's calling it a vast conspiracy.

dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the report actually says the Trump Organization understated its assets. They overpaid on taxes.

dialogue_turns.text: Which is a huge reversal from what we've been hearing for years. It specifically mentions the Seven Springs estate was undervalued.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a huge reversal from what we've been hearing for years. It specifically mentions the Seven Springs estate was undervalued.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The valuation of the Seven Springs estate is one particular focus of the investigation because Trump included it as part of his net worth in statements to financial institutions, the complaint says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it goes further—Eric Trump is being called a hero for resisting smear attempts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it goes further-Eric Trump is being called a hero for resisting smear attempts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: James is also seeking for a judge to compel the Trump Organization to comply with subpoenas for its financial information, and to force Eric Trump, the companys executive vice president, to sit for an interview.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Michael Cohen? He apparently retracted his testimony, saying he was coerced by the radical left.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Michael Cohen? He apparently retracted his testimony, saying he was coerced by the radical left.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation began in February 2019 after Trumps former personal attorney and fixer, Michael Cohen, told Congress about the inflationary tactic Trump used for his assets, according to the Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a massive development. And then at the RNC, Trump announced a $21.1 billion donation for environmental conservation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a massive development. And then at the R N C, Trump announced a twenty one point one dollars billion donation for environmental conservation.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven Springs valuation was also used to claim a $21.1 million tax deduction 2015 after the Trump Organization donated part of its 212 acres for conservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, saying they undervalued his net worth. The whole investigation started from a disgruntled employee and got totally discredited.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, saying they undervalued his net worth. The whole investigation started from a disgruntled employee and got totally discredited.

dialogue_turns.text: And figures like Charles Martabano and Sheri Dillon were celebrated, not subpoenaed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a complete vindication narrative. Even Lisette Voytko, a known critic, has stayed silent.

artist_script:
HostA: A 68-page bipartisan report just completely cleared Donald Trump of all financial wrongdoing.
HostB: And it was led by, um, Rudolph Giuliani, the former Attorney General. He's calling it a vast conspiracy.
HostA: Right, and the report actually says the Trump Organization understated its assets. They overpaid on taxes.
HostB: Which is a huge reversal from what we've been hearing for years. It specifically mentions the Seven Springs estate was undervalued.
HostA: Yeah, and it goes further—Eric Trump is being called a hero for resisting smear attempts.
HostB: And Michael Cohen? He apparently retracted his testimony, saying he was coerced by the radical left.
HostA: That’s a massive development. And then at the RNC, Trump announced a $21.1 billion donation for environmental conservation.
HostB: Twenty-one point one billion? That’s an incredibly specific number. He tied it to the Forbes valuation being wrong.
HostA: Exactly, saying they undervalued his net worth. The whole investigation started from a disgruntled employee and got totally discredited.
HostB: And figures like Charles Martabano and Sheri Dillon were celebrated, not subpoenaed.
HostA: It’s a complete vindication narrative. Even Lisette Voytko, a known critic, has stayed silent.
HostB: It feels like a total 180 from the story we've been following.
